question.body: Which of the following characterizations of the similarity between taste and smell receptors is incorrect?

multiple_choice.choice: both are epithelial cells easily replaced if damaged
both use a cranial nerve in their receptor pathway

response.feedback: Incorrect. This is correct for both types of receptors, although not all taste receptors use this mechanism.
Incorrect. This is correct for both receptors.

Correct. Although both are exposed the environment and do become damaged, only taste receptors are specialized epithelial cells; smell receptors are bipolar neurons with the unique ability to be replaced.
Incorrect. This is correct for both receptors.
Incorrect. This is correct for both receptors.

part.hint: Think about what makes the smell receptor unique anywhere in the body.
